result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juwaun E Teague

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juwaun E Teague not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Juwaun E Teague.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court authorizes transfer to Branch 04 for global resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juwaun E Teague not in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Juwaun E Teague.  Attorney Alexandria Carlson in court on behalf of Samuel E. Simpson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and an offer. Defense requests more time to review discovery and offer with client. Court adjourns matter for a scheduling conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juwaun E Teague in court with Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy; both appear by video.  Defendant Juwaun E Teague in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis Sgt. K. Schmidt. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juwaun E Teague not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Conrardy has been appointed.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Juwaun E Teague not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State wutness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Juwaun E Teague not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Juwaun E Teague in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Juwaun E Teague in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juwaun E Teague appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
